column5: Luckily there wasn‚Äôt any negative physical impacts. I hear you though- if my gender role was reversed I would never do that to someone. It fucking sucks trying to get it through my brain that it wasn‚Äôt right, because denial is my go to coping mechanism apparently lol

I asked myself this so much too, and ultimately it comes down to how it affected you. If you‚Äôre asking if it was abuse, I think it is. How you feel is not up for debate by anyone, especially the perpetrator. You know how you feel. I‚Äôm sorry you‚Äôre stuck with these thoughts, they can be so heavy.

It‚Äôs a very heavy thing to deal with, and dreams are our minds way of processing some of the memories/feelings. I have nightmares, but they‚Äôre not always ‚Äúmemories‚Äù of the trauma. For me, I have dreams where I feel the emotions around my trauma such as being helpless and abandoned, scared, embarrassed, and gross. During my waking hours throughout my life I have a hard time feeling those emotions. I have BPD and I tend to just detach from it, so dreams are a normal response. I know how disturbing they are, and I‚Äôm glad you‚Äôre working through recovery. Establishing a routine throughout my day sometimes helps me so I know what to predict. Lots of love to you ‚ù§Ô∏è

Like I‚Äôm completely blank. For some reason, my body tends to run on the colder side and it contributes to an overall feeling of numbness. My emotions seem to be pushed into a very far corner of my brain, and I can‚Äôt access it. It sucks when you just want to feel something, but then it‚Äôs too much to feel lol

I think that‚Äôs exactly what she‚Äôs doing. My family wants me in there life and they think this is the best way to do it. She said that we all need to heal and it‚Äôs ‚Äúbigger than just me‚Äù. They‚Äôre about 19 years too late though. It‚Äôs sad to realize this is how your family is. I feel for you, not getting closure seems to be a big hurdle. Especially for doing trauma therapy, it can be hard if you don‚Äôt even have a full memory.

I‚Äôm a property manager. I suggest looking into your own states laws, but release of info is like never required lmao PLEASE contact the HUD as soon as possible. They‚Äôll get in a lot of legal trouble conducting business like this, I‚Äôm so sorry!!! You should never feel the need to disclose your illness unless you want to. This pisses me off that people are like this. Best of luck!

Are you underage? I‚Äôm so sorry you‚Äôre going through this, how your mom is reacting is not right. However, I‚Äôm just someone on the internet and can‚Äôt understand your financial situation. But at the end of the day, YOU are the only one who can look out for yourself. I had to come to that realization with my family before I cut them out of my life. Is there a way you can start working and maybe find a way to get out of the house?  I‚Äôm not sure where you live or how old you are, but housing and food assistance is usually available. You‚Äôre so incredibly strong!! If this is what you‚Äôre living through, please don‚Äôt doubt your strength.

I‚Äôm not using it as an excuse, people experience BPD differently. I also have nothing to be excused from, I haven‚Äôt hurt or done any damage to anyone. Hindsight is 20/20 and I‚Äôm just looking for perspective
I don‚Äôt work directly with him, so I don‚Äôt see him at all when I‚Äôm at work. I‚Äôve slept with a coworker at all of my jobs lmao just how my BPD is

The unfortunate thing about sexual abuse, so I‚Äôm learning, is many of us don‚Äôt even realize it was wrong or label it as abuse until much later in life. Probably because we don‚Äôt have any perspective when we‚Äôre younger but when we are adults we have more experience to compare it. I‚Äôm 22 (f) and also coming to terms with the abuse from my older sister, so my heart goes out to you.

I‚Äôm sorry that happened to you. Yes, that qualifies as abuse. You weren‚Äôt a ‚Äúhorny‚Äù kid, it‚Äôs up for people older than children to say no. It sounds like he was grooming you with the game you would play, but I think it was a saving grace he exited your lives before it continued. I‚Äôm sorry for what you‚Äôre going through, but the first step in healing is facing the truth ‚ù§Ô∏è.
Sending love to you ‚ù§Ô∏è you‚Äôre so strong, never forget that
I‚Äôve been doing okay but psych is still increasing my dose. If my panic attacks and dissociation weren‚Äôt so bad I would stop the meds and smoke, but I can‚Äôt lol
Possibly. How long were you on it before starting to smoke?

No, I completely agree with you. For me, my mental health is a little more important than my chronic pain bc my mental health makes my chronic pain worse. I‚Äôm also getting surgery this week to remove a herniated disk that has caused me nerve pain for almost 2 years, so hopefully that helps.
I miss dabbing üò≠üòÇ
High anxiety can cause you to sweat, mine does. I usually sweat A TON while I‚Äôm sleeping. Do you notice you‚Äôre dehydrated at the same time throughout the day? Also meds may cause this

Yes! For some reason I imagine myself talking to people I know about my issues...super odd because I never talk about my problems lol I think it‚Äôs therapeutic but also makes me escape my reality for a little

I feel like I may have the same experience. I‚Äôve been having non stop nightmares lately and I have been coming down with something the last week- it is only today it developed into a mild head cold. I get extremely tired sometimes too, similar to how you feel before you get sick. I‚Äôm sorry :( try to take care of yourself the best you can, and stock up on soothing teas and soups/preferred sick foods. Makes it a little more bearable.

It was the frequency for sure. I was also crying every single morning on my way to work, although I enjoy my job and the time I spend at work. I wouldn‚Äôt try to wait until you reach a breaking point, if you‚Äôre thinking about medication it‚Äôs probably a sign you should start looking into it. My advise is to communicate your concerns with your doctor and they should be able to find the right fit and dosage. Not every medication will completely change you, but it will help.
I never wanted to stay on medication, but I came to the conclusion my brain functioning requires it- it‚Äôs just the way I am unfortunately. I tried many many alternatives and nothing worked for me

I have been on and off many medications in the last 6 years or so, never staying on them for more than 6 months. Recently, I was having panic attacks every single day and my life has gotten extremely dark and painful. I decided I could no longer live without medication because thinking about my trauma on top of all my symptoms, was honestly killing me. You don‚Äôt need to be at the breaking point, but medication helps you stabilize a little more so you can start to heal. It takes a while to find the right meds, don‚Äôt give up.

I‚Äôve ALWAYS felt exhausted when I wake up and my anxiety is at its worst when I wake up. My psych prescribed prazosin to hopefully help me sleep better but I wasn‚Äôt getting nightmares very often. Over the last year I was smoking weed daily all day for my anxiety, so I think it kept my dreams at bay. Now that I‚Äôm not smoking and on psych meds my nightmares are almost nightly within the last month...and I 100% know it‚Äôs not due to my meds.

I‚Äôm not sure how you identify, but if you really think it would help I would look into surgery‚Äôs. I‚Äôve looked into getting a breast reduction and MANY surgeons will be hesitant to remove all of your breast tissue if you‚Äôre female, just something to be aware of. I would also consider how long you have been dealing with these symptoms and how you may feel later in life. I can feel the pain you are going through now, but maybe be mindful on how you may recover in the future and if you may regret removing them completely- coming from a very impulsive person lol.  But I completely understand needing to do things out of the ‚Äúnorm‚Äù to feel safe again, and don‚Äôt let anyone deter you from this.

I feel you, but please know there is nothing you can do. It is up to others to have respect for other people, and I really recommend building up confidence so you can speak up for yourself. This is my most difficult issue and it‚Äôs HARD. To feel more comfortable, I usually wear hats, sunglasses, and baggier clothes so people don‚Äôt look at me in public. I hate feeling like everyone‚Äôs eyes are on me.

I have a hard time using the word abuser since I had a similar experience and it was my sister. I put a lot of blame on my parents since they created an environment that allowed it to happen and I consider them abusers. I don‚Äôt think it matters what you label it, it only matters the effect it has on you now. I feel we get overworked about creating a label for our trauma, and sometimes it‚Äôs healthy to just look at the situation for how it affects you vs labeling. I suggest maybe coming up with another word you‚Äôd like to use instead of ‚Äúabuser‚Äù until you decide it feels right to use the term- if you never want to use that term it‚Äôs your own choice also!!

Don‚Äôt feel guilty- you‚Äôre abuser wanted it this way and they are so good at making you complicit. It‚Äôs easier to abuse children this way, so why wouldn‚Äôt they? From my understanding, it is so much more difficult when the abuse is normalized.
I feel you. It‚Äôs so painful, but you can‚Äôt retract your memories once you realize what happened. It‚Äôs just a never ending cycle in my head thinking about the abuse. Much love to you.
As I read what I wrote it makes me realize I minimize it too, but it feels like my experience happened to someone else. If that makes sense?
I know it wasn‚Äôt my idea, but I also know I didn‚Äôt say no because I was under the impression we were playing.

And it‚Äôs never been mentioned at all since the event happened. My sister recently made a comment a few months back about not remembering parts of her childhood, so she possibly forgot. I cut off my family officially a few weeks back. I had stopped responding to calls and messages and they all showed up at my house to confront me, and I basically told them to fuck off

I‚Äôm female and my older sibling was my sister. I grew up with a sex addict father where his behaviors were rather covert, but my parents divorced when I was 11 and I found out all of his behaviors at a young age. I do have some sexual-oriented memories from when I was pretty young though which Im guessing my parents thought we wouldn‚Äôt remember. He was consistently cheating on my mother with prostitutes, spending time & loads of money at strip clubs, etc. I‚Äôm thinking my sister found porn on our FAMILY computer that we all had access to because my father did not ever delete his search history...he‚Äôs not the smartest one in the bunch but it was never malicious on his part.
That makes me feel better. Abuse is still abuse even if it is seen as ‚Äúminor‚Äù in our minds I guess

Yeeesssss! I‚Äôve been vegan for almost 7 years but my diet and weight have always changed drastically. I‚Äôll gain and lose weight so rapidly it makes me really upset. Finding clothes to wear is even worse because every 6 months they don‚Äôt fit anymore and are either too tight or too loose. It‚Äôs the worst.

I‚Äôm in a very similar position as you right now. My abuser was my sister when I was about 4-6 years old and my mom knew about it, but it‚Äôs never been mentioned again. I recently cut off my family and I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll ever be able to have them in my life again because of the pain, shame, and disgust I feel. 

I would wait on responding and really think how YOU want your relationship with her to look like. It sounds like you truly want a good relationship with her, but maybe reflect on if there is any pressure to normalize things for you. For me, it was so much easier pushing down emotions to have a relationship with my family. I want a loving family and to be a part of it, but I can‚Äôt forgive the abuse I suffered and how it‚Äôs affected my life now.   Would having a relationship with her be the healthiest thing for you? If so, I would try to do as much healing as you can to be in a good place with her. Tell her you need some time maybe? This way you may not feel pressured but you can communicate on your terms.

Yes, I completely avoid tampons and have for years. For me it‚Äôs extremely uncomfortable to have to insert one or think about it being inside me. My best advise is to find someway to cover up a pad while you‚Äôre at work. I know there are ‚Äúperiod‚Äù underwear that will soak up your flow also, maybe this is an option if you have to be in the water?

This resonates so much with me as well. If you are still living with the person, your brain is going to protect you until you feel safe. You‚Äôre in therapy and taking medication which is awesome! But if you do feel trapped, I recommend taking a step back from extra curriculars until you can get financially stable to leave. This should be your first priority- you owe it to yourself and your mental health. I wasn‚Äôt able to even realize my abuse until recently, and it‚Äôs been almost 3 years since I haven‚Äôt lived with my abuser. Healing takes time. I‚Äôm sorry you‚Äôre going through this.
I relate to this so hard. Working is a nightmare but when I have more than 2 days off my brain starts to self destruct
